verses.text:
Seeking the lost, yes, kindly entreating
Wanderers on the mountains astray;
'Come unto me,' his message repeating,
Words of the Master speaking today.

Seeking the lost, and pointing to Jesus,
Souls that are weak and hearts that are sore;
Leading them forth from sorrow and sadness,
Thus would I go for Jesus calls me.

Thus would I go for Jesus calls me,
Him would I follow day by day;
Care for the dying, raise up the fallen,
This is my work while others play.

chorus.text:
Going afar upon the mountain,
Bringing the wanderers back again,
Into the fold of my Redeemer,
Jesus the Lamb for sinners slain.
